channel.title: How and where to put a starter command?
channel.description:
Hello,
I'm using slipknot v3. But unfortunately there is no starter command
how do i code one? and where do i put it?>
Thanks!

item.title: How and where to put a starter command?
item.dc:creator: @Ic3_Barrage Ic3 Barrage
item.description:
@Ic3_Barrage wrote:

[quote=“kevlord2, post:3, topic:199790”]for a starter cmd use

[code]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“starter”)) {
if (starter == 0) {
addItem(995, 1000000);
addItem(392, 15000);
sendMessage(“Your message here”);
starter = 1;
savemoreinfo();
savechar();
} else if (starter == 1) {
sendMessage(“Why do you have to be greedy?”);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName+ " is really greedy trying to type ::starter again");

}[/code][/quote]

And put that command above a command in your client.java

Read full topic
item.source: How and where to put a starter command?

item.title: How and where to put a starter command?
item.dc:creator: @Ic3_Barrage Ic3 Barrage
item.description:
@Ic3_Barrage wrote:

i got a suggestion.
1st, find a source that has a Starter Command.
2nd, Download that source, extract it,
3rd, open client.java, and search (Ctrl + F) for starter", yes with the ".
4th, copy the whole command, and then open your source, and your source’s client.java
5th, Search (Ctrl + F) for a command in the game, and Paste (Ctrl + V) the command
for starter into your new source, above the command, like above the…
if (command.startswith(“commandname”)
or
if (command.equalsignorecase(“commandname”)
and then compile, and run, then it should work.
Hiyascape V2 has the starter command, btw.

Read full topic
item.source: How and where to put a starter command?
